name: Language
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Natural Language.

First, install @google-cloud/language with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/language

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/languageâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var language = require('@google-cloud/language')();

Elsewhere

var language = require('@google-cloud/language')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/language are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: languageV1
methods.description:
Create an languageServiceClient with additional helpers for common tasks.

Provides text analysis operations such as sentiment analysis and entity recognition.

params.name: options.email
params.description: • Account email address. Required when using a .pem or .p12 keyFilename.

params.name: options.keyFilename
params.description: • Full path to the a .json, .pem, or .p12 key downloaded from the Google Developers Console. If you provide a path to a JSON file, the projectId option above is not necessary. NOTE: .pem and .p12 require you to specify options.email as well.

params.name: options.port
params.description: • The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: options.projectId
params.description: • The project ID from the Google Developer's Console, e.g. 'grape-spaceship-123'. We will also check the environment variable GCLOUD_PROJECT for your project ID. If your app is running in an environment which supports {@link https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/application-default-credentials Application Default Credentials}, your project ID will be detected automatically.

params.name: options.promise
params.description: • Custom promise module to use instead of native Promises.

params.name: options.servicePath
params.description: • The domain name of the API remote host.
